intro: Euryops jaberiana, commonly known as the Cape St. George daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers surrounded by white ray florets. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Euryops jaberiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
